title: Functions passed in props are not updated
body:
`todos` is an array, `v` is React.createElement, and I render: (It's not in jsx, but you'll understand)

``` js
todos.map((todo,i)=>
    v('li', {/*...*/},
        v(TodoItem, {
            text: todo.text,
            update: text=>console.log('update',i)||this.updateTodo(i,{text}) // (*)
        })
    )
)
```

TodoItems can be [dragged](https://github.com/caub/todo-list/blob/gh-pages/TodoList.js#L67-L85), and their text is updated [onBlur](https://github.com/caub/todo-list/blob/gh-pages/TodoItem.js#L37) (so just clicking anywhere outside the current text)

I was surprised I get [this issue (gif)](https://github.com/caub/todo-list/blob/f5ca6f6157c3355eff69b33a9e7bf68ade50a204/propsfunctionissue.gif). The passed arrow functions `text=>this.updateTodo(i,{text})` are not updated after a new render call, so the i that should be 2 at the end of the gif, is still 0.

I should observe in logs:

```
update 0
update 1
update 2
update 2 // with the first item that got dragged in last position
```

Maybe it's like that since forever, but it's surprising and not too intuitive, it's maybe an optimization that you did?

demo with the issue: https://caub.github.io/todo-list/ 

**edit**: having `key = {i}` instead of `key = {todo.id}` would fix this issue, but it breaks the CSS transitions
